intro: Capanemia, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of the true hibiscus. They typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as fruits. Capanemia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms.
